content: Revenue growth year-over-year was primarily driven by growth in Israel, which was up 263% year-over-year, largely attributable to the cannabis flower category in growth in Canada, which was up 79% year-over-year, led by our cannabis extracts category, which we see to boost through the introduction of our gummies platform, which did not exist in the prior year, as well as an introduction of a one-gram date which provides great value to the consumer. Turning to the US segment, we reported net revenue in the first quarter of 2022 of $2.3 million, which represents a 5% decrease from the first quarter of 2021, the decrease year-over-year was primarily driven by a reduction in volumes as a result of a decrease in promotional spend as the company works through its review of the US business as part of the strategic realignment.
